review: Was prescribed 100mg for insomnia I have experienced migraines all my life, had ovarian cysts rupture, broken a few bones, had appendicitis. I have never experienced pain as terrible as the trazodone headache. It woke me up and wouldn’t leave for 2 days nothing helps you can’t sleep it off. There is no relief. I would never recommend this medication on the off chance you experience this headache as well.

I used to get severe migraines where I was in a dark room with a cold rag on my head for a day or two. My doctor prescribed trazodone and I’ve been taking it for 10+ years and I don’t have headaches anymore I haven’t had any side effects. It’s been a lifesaver.
I am take half a pill 50MG and have developed severe migraines in the front of my head right over my right eyebrow. I am fairly certain it’s the Trazadone that is causing the headaches.

I was taking trazodone for sleep 50 mg after a couple months it wasn't helping anymore my dr. switched me to 100 mg and after about a week I started to have bad headaches so I went back to 50 mg and the headaches stopped for a couple days, then they started up again. I stopped taking the drug and its been three days now the headaches have not gone away, I am hoping that another day or so they will be gone but right now I am suffering with them.
I can’t take this medication because, although it helps me sleep, I wake up the next morning with a horrible headache and extreme lethargy. It feels like a really bad hangover.
Awful, pulsating headache. 10/10 pain and nothing helped. Only after one use. It definitely put me to sleep though

Apparently people who have migraines on a regular ... Trazodone helps. But for me, it was prescribed to me yesterday for insomnia. I took it for the first time last night and woke up with a head ache, which lead into a migraine for the entire day. You would laugh if you came across what I look like right now. I have a hot rice pack, full of lavender essential oil, hanging over my head. It's only getting worse. Idk if I will take another one tonight. I tried coffee. Pressure points. Twilight ...

I don’t recommend trazadone at ALL nfor headches. It did make me sleepy, but it also made me feel a bit dizzy and nauseous. which gave me major anxiety. The next day I woke up with a pounding headache and I couldn’t move my head. It was terrible. It lasted 2 days. I wasn’t sure if it was the medication at first or not, so I waited about a week to try it again and the same thing happened. I’m aware everyone is different when it comes to the tolerance of medication, but I hope this was helpful.

My provider has been prescribing me this medication trazodone for last 2 years for a sleep aid. At first I did not realize how & where I was getting all the throbbing migraine headaches & the major sexual side affects until I did research. To walk around popping excedrin all day & NEVER able to get an ERECTION was awful. Not worth a dime to me, finally discontinued. I stayed awake all day & exercised & was able to sleep 8 hrs fine now. Just be active all day.
I experienced several migraines a month which were debilitating. My physician prescribed Trazodone and I only get 1 or 2 per month. I’ve been taking if for a few years now and completely satisfied.

After decades of insomnia I thought I had found the help I needed. I slept for 7-9 hours every night. It was great for the first month then the headaches started every few days and they would last for 2-3 days. I also have a history of migraines, but researched and discovered I could not take sumatriptan with Trazodone. Taking NSAIDs are not good either. So I’m going to discontinue.
Wow! I am surprised by all these negative reviews!  Trazodone has helped prevent migraines in my experience! Sleep better
I had a horrible headache the entire next day. Also felt tired and out of it. I’d rather deal with being tired from no sleep than the way this drug made me feel the next day.

I took this medication for a few years for my migraines, I suffered from tremors, stomach issues, constipation, blurred vision and skin issues. Basically almost all of the side effects listed I suffered from. It was not till I missed two days did I know about the withdrawals which were very bad. I slowly weaned off this medication and for over six weeks dealt with withdrawals. After I stopped my headaches changed and are not as bad. I didn’t know my meds were making me sicker. While on it I was 50 lbs under weight and diagnosed with anorexia, for me the best was getting off this. My opinion is this is very bad for me.  If you take this be sure not to ignore your feelings and issues you didn’t see prior to taking this.Just be careful...
This medicine is absolutely horrible for headaches I'm on day 4 of a bad migraine due to this medicine. I would not recommend it at all!!
I take the medication once in a while and I get terrible headaches in the morning

granted it does make you sleep. But when I get up and the morning I always have a headache most of the day I felt bad and tired I have no energy I do not like to take it unless I need to I find out clonazepam 0.5 two of them and two of hydroxyz 25 mg make me sleep just as well as trazodone 50 mg. that give Me a headache every time the other two  Pills I take
I've been on this for 2 weeks after Paxil for 3 years, the crushing headache is intense. I will give it 1 more week to see if I adjust
Horrible headache the day after (tried it on three different occasions to make sure it wasn't something else) and could do nothing other than lay in bed in the dark.

Trazodone has been a miracle for me. It has helped my headaches, which I was having daily. It also has caused me to lose some weight, which makes me feel better. It has also helped with my anxiety. Only problem I have had so far, is that if I take it too late at night, I will feel groggy in the morning. I am on 100mgs.
